The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** The coordinate system for this part has an euler angle of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0029, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch:** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. **Create the first face (face_1):** Draw a rectangle by creating four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1488] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1488], End Point [0.0, 0.1488] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1488], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch:** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch:** Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system to transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch:** Extrude the sketch along its normal axis with a depth of 0.0014 units in both directions. This will create a 3D solid with a height that is approximately twice the width. The final dimensions of this part will be a length of 0.75 units, a width of approximately 0.0029 units, and a height of 0.75 units. Repeat the above steps for all the parts mentioned in the CAD Assembly JSON. Remember to update the dimensions, coordinate systems, sketches, and extrusions according to the JSON data for each part. Also, provide clear headings and section breaks for each part to keep the instructions organized.</description>
